Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet Gallery should reject malformed packages" (#6353) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This is motivated by https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7239.

The following package https://www.nuget.org/packages/foundation-sites/6.4.3, has both a `Content/Scripts` directory and a `Content/Scripts` file, which blows up when the client tries to install it. 

![foundation-sites-6 4 3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2878341/44755770-5c211880-aadc-11e8-8c33-0d4e8d14a5f5.png)

If you try to extract this package with any zip extractor tool it will warn you about duplicate files. 

//cc @loic-sharma

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search]Owners appears to not be updating in search." (#6352) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The auxiliary data file used to sew in owners into search results appears to be stale.
Job that generates it appears to be running.
Blob storage appears to have updated files.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Gallery] On upload, warn if package contains HTTP links" (#6351) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
On upload, warn if the package contains HTTP links in the following metadata:

* Project URL
* Repository URL
* Release Notes content
* Description content
* Package Icon URL
* License URL

#2854 

- Edit page "Cancel" and "Submit" buttons redirect to previous page.
- Delete page "Save" button redirect to previous page.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[WebScout] HTTP Links to Microsoft resources" (#6347) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Background

WebScout complains that there are unsecured HTTP links on nuget.org that point to Microsoft resources. These links originate from packages uploaded by customers.

# Affected Metadata

* Project Url (example: https://int.nugettest.org/packages/Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc/5.2.3)
* Release Notes (example: https://int.nugettest.org/packages/Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc/5.2.3)
* Description (example: https://int.nugettest.org/packages/Microsoft.Bcl.Async/1.0.168)
* Package Icon Url (example: https://int.nugettest.org/packages/System.Threading.Tasks/4.0.10)
* License Url (example: https://int.nugettest.org/packages/Microsoft.AspNet.OData.pt-br/5.4.0)

# Proposed Solution

## Package Icons / Licenses

Package icons and licenses will be "fixed" by self-contained packages (see https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6270). All icon/license links on nuget.org will be HTTPS.  /cc @zivkan @agr 

## Other Metadata

For all other metadata:

* A warning will be displayed on upload if the package's metadata contains HTTP links
  * TODO. Tracked by XYZ
* A warning will be displayed on the package's display page to its owners if the package's metadata contains HTTP links
  * TODO: Tracked by XYZ
* Project URL (tracked by https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6248)
  * If the project URL is an HTTP link, it will be hidden on its package's display package page
  * We will "update" packages' project URLs to HTTPS if they are for well known hosts (like Microsoft, GitHub, etc).
* Description / Release Notes (tracked by https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6248)
  * HTTP links will no longer be transformed to HTML anchor tags

/cc @anangaur @blowdart @skofman1

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGetGallery.Core package produced by build.ps1 has no dependencies" (#6348) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Due to https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5979.

When we moved NuGetGallery.Core to `PackageReference`, this regressed.

In NuGet.Jobs, Validation.Common.Job package works because the .csproj has a .nuspec next to it with the explicit dependencies. And a test to assert that the .csproj and .nuspec dependencies does not diverge.

We could also follow the workaround in the client issue above.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[WebScout] HTTP Links to Microsoft resources" (#6347) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
WebScout complains that there are unsecured HTTP links on nuget.org that point to Microsoft resources. These links originate from packages uploaded by customers. We should either:

1. Remove the protocol for Microsoft resources. Ex: `http://go.microsoft.com/abc` -> `go.microsoft.com/abc`
2. Force HTTPS protocol. Ex: `http://go.microsoft.com/abc` -> `https://go.microsoft.com/abc`
3. Ignore these issues and suppress WebScout's warnings.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Revalidation] Don't email customers if the package is already available" (#6326) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: We are revalidating all packages to repository sign them. These revalidations should not email customers.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Upload Progress bugs" (#6085) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
There seems to be two bugs in the upload flow:

1. The "upload-progress" endpoint is polled even after the package has finished upload and the user is verifying the metadata
2. The upload bar will be stuck at 0 if the file upload request takes a long time to reach the server. This happens because if the "upload-progress" endpoint is polled 3 times before the upload starts, the UI will stop polling.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Better leverage h2 via http headers" (#4524) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
For the new preview site have a look at the waterfall (note i am using chrome for the below)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/122666/29100366-788371fc-7cee-11e7-8f17-73e1ee1affed.png)

Note that despite using h2 there is no Multiplexing. The reason for this is that the response headers contain no [rel=preload headers](https://caniuse.com/#feat=link-rel-preload)

you may also want to look into `dns-prefetch` and `preconnect` headers https://www.keycdn.com/blog/resource-hints/

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Accessibility - Fix nav roles" (#6345) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
JAWS has a bug where they do not read our nav bar's tabs correctly.

After more analysis, it appears that we are using roles incorrectly, and we can avoid the bug by fixing our usage of roles.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget pack with csproj throwing NullReferenceException at Microsoft.Build.Shared.BuildEnvironmentHelper.get_Instance()" (#7142) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet version: 4.6.2.5055
OS version: Windows Server 2016, version 10.0
TeamCity version: 2018.1

NuGet is unable to pack a csproj. on a TeamCity agent(s). But have not found any reason why it should not work. Especially that the agents is building solutions without any problems, nuget restore also work properly.
Locally (on developer environment) the nuget pack works fine.

Worked before? No.

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

`nuget pack "ConsoleApplication1\ConsoleApplication1.csproj" -Verbosity detailed -Properties Configuration=Release`

## Other suggested things

It might be some problems with MSBuild itself.
The same issue occurs for NuGet 4.4.1.4656
Right now my workaround is not using the csproj for nuget pack, but defining everything inside the nupkg.

### Verbose Logs

> NuGet Version: 4.6.2.5055
> Attempting to build package from 'ConsoleApplication1.csproj'.
> MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '15.7.179.6572' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\MSBuild\15.0\bin'. Use option -MSBuildVersion to force nuget to use a specific version of MSBuild.
> Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
> System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
>     at Microsoft.Build.Shared.BuildEnvironmentHelper.get_Instance()
>     at Microsoft.Build.Shared.NativeMethodsShared.get_IsMono()
>     at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.Logging.LoggingService..ctor(LoggerMode loggerMode, Int32 nodeId)
>     at Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection.CreateLoggingService(Int32 maxCPUCount, Boolean onlyLogCriticalEvents)
>     at Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection..ctor(IDictionary`2 globalProperties, IEnumerable`1 loggers, IEnumerable`1 remoteLoggers, ToolsetDefinitionLocations toolsetDefinitionLocations, Int32 maxNodeCount, Boolean onlyLogCriticalEvents)
>     at Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection.get_GlobalProjectCollection()
>     at Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project..ctor(String projectFile, IDictionary`2 globalProperties, String toolsVersion)

### Sample Project

Any C# console application with .NET Framework 4.5.2.
There is no ConsoleApplication1.nuspec

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place.

2.

...

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget.exe restore doesn't produce .props and .targets files " (#7073) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I've hit the same problem detailed here: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/2711 (closed and fixed in a previous version) this is with nuget 4.1.0.2450

Doing:

C:\Users\someuser\Source>nuget restore MyProject

MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '15.6.85.37198' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Professional\MSBuild\15.0\bin'.
Restoring NuGet package a
Restoring NuGet package b
Restoring NuGet package c
...
NuGet Config files used:
    C:\Users\SomeUser\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config
    C:\Program Files (x86)\NuGet\Config\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Offline.config

Feeds used:
    C:\Users\SomeUser\.nuget\packages\
    https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
    C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\NuGetPackages\

Installed:
    3 package(s) to packages.config projects

--------------------------------------------

Packages were restored, but are all missing the .props and .target files, so the solution doesn't build.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget mirror command" (#7238) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): nuget.exe
NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 2.8.60717.93
OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): OS Name	Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise

We are hosting an old internal NuGet server v3.9999.9999 which was recompiled after local changes by someone who has left, Server works fine, however, I am trying to add more packages to the server required by one of our team. I am trying to add the following packages:

  <package id="CacheManager.Core" version="1.1.2" targetFramework="net451" />
  <package id="CacheManager.Serialization.ProtoBuf" version="1.1.2" targetFramework="net451" />
  <package id="CacheManager.StackExchange.Redis" version="1.1.2" targetFramework="net451" />
  <package id="CacheManager.SystemRuntimeCaching" version="1.1.2" targetFramework="net451" />
  <package id="protobuf-net" version="2.1.0" targetFramework="net451" />
  <package id="StackExchange.Redis.StrongName" version="1.2.6" targetFramework="net451" />

First I tried this via the web interface but I get this error:
The element 'metadata' in namespace 'http://schemas.microsoft.com/packaging/2013/05/nuspec.xsd' has invalid child element 'repository' in namespace 'http://schemas.microsoft.com/packaging/2013/05/nuspec.xsd'. List of possible elements expected: 'frameworkAssemblies, developmentDependency, dependencies, summary, language, references, title' in namespace 'http://schemas.microsoft.com/packaging/2013/05/nuspec.xsd'. Details…

So then I tried mirroring the packages within the server. We have a BAT file with the following command:

NuGet mirror packages.config http://xxxxx.co.uk/api/v2/ http://xxxxx.co.uk/ -source https://nuget.org/api/v2 -ApiKey xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx -NoCache -verbosity detailed > logs\mirror.txt  2>&1

This uses NuGet 2.8.60717.93. However, I am getting this error:

GET https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/NETStandard.Library/1.6.0
System.InvalidOperationException: 'NETStandard.Library' already has a dependency defined for 'Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms'.
   at NuGet.Manifest.ValidateDependencySets(IPackageMetadata metadata)
   at NuGet.Manifest.Validate(Manifest manifest)

I believe the above issue is fixed in latest nuget.exe, however, the 'mirror' command has been deprecated after 3.2+ so I cannot use the latest nuget.exe version. I tried to look for NuGet.ServerExtensions.dll as per https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-mirror but cannot locate the extension. As a test, I tried to mirror only Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms as follows:

NuGet mirror Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms http://xxxxx.co.uk/api/v2/ http://xxxx.co.uk/ -source https://nuget.org/api/v2 -ApiKey xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx -version 2.1.1 -NoCache -verbosity detailed

and now I get a different error:

NuGet.NuGetVersionNotSatisfiedException: The 'Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms 1.0.1' package requires NuGet client version '2.12' or above, but the current NuGet version is '2.8.60717.93'.
   at NuGet.PackageWalker.CheckPackageMinClientVersion(IPackage package)

I cannot find nuget.exe v2.12 anywhere so next I tried to copy one of the packages (without dependencies) directly to local NuGet cache and shared file storage:

C:\Users\xxxx\AppData\Local\NuGet\Cache
\\xxxxx.co.uk\itshared\Lab\Build\Nuget\packages (i.e. FileStorageDirectory)

but this has also not helped - even after re-indexing.

We are not in a position to upgrade our server yet and might do this in the future. For now I am looking to upload the packages as the team is blocked. There is nothing in the server logs to suggest any errors. 

Do you have any suggestions/workaround on how I can mirror the packages? 

Why copying the package to the above folders is not taking effect even after re-indexing? 

Also, 

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create packages.config and aforementioned packages.
2. Get nuget.exe 2.8
3. Run following command:
NuGet mirror packages.config http://xxxxx.co.uk/api/v2/ http://xxx.co.uk/ -source https://nuget.org/api/v2 -ApiKey 579dacc9-02e0-47f8-bb88-aceef07b4fe4 -NoCache -verbosity detailed > logs\mirror.txt  2>&1

## Other suggested things
See above

### Verbose Logs
GET http://library.nuget.cityindex.co.uk/api/v2/Packages()?$filter=tolower(Id) eq 'cachemanager.core'&$orderby=Id
GET https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/Packages(Id='CacheManager.Core',Version='1.1.2')
GET http://library.nuget.cityindex.co.uk/api/v2/Packages()?$filter=tolower(Id) eq 'cachemanager.core'&$orderby=Id
GET http://library.nuget.cityindex.co.uk/api/v2/Packages()?$filter=tolower(Id) eq 'cachemanager.core'&$orderby=Id
Attempting to resolve dependency 'NETStandard.Library (= 1.6.1)'.
GET http://library.nuget.cityindex.co.uk/api/v2/Packages()?$filter=tolower(Id) eq 'netstandard.library'&$orderby=Id
GET https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='NETStandard.Library'
GET https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/NETStandard.Library/1.6.1
System.InvalidOperationException: 'NETStandard.Library' already has a dependency defined for 'Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms'.
   at NuGet.Manifest.ValidateDependencySets(IPackageMetadata metadata)
   at NuGet.Manifest.Validate(Manifest manifest)
   at NuGet.Manifest.ReadFrom(Stream stream, IPropertyProvider propertyProvider, Boolean validateSchema)
   at NuGet.LocalPackage.ReadManifest(Stream manifestStream)
   at NuGet.OptimizedZipPackage.EnsureManifest()
   at NuGet.OptimizedZipPackage..ctor(IFileSystem fileSystem, String packagePath)
   at NuGet.LocalPackageRepository.OpenPackage(String path)
   at NuGet.LocalPackageRepository.GetPackage(Func`2 openPackage, String path)
   at NuGet.LocalPackageRepository.<>c__DisplayClass13.<FindPackage>b__f(String path)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.FirstOrDefault[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at NuGet.LocalPackageRepository.FindPackage(Func`2 openPackage, String packageId, SemanticVersion version)
   at NuGet.LocalPackageRepository.FindPackage(String packageId, SemanticVersion version)
   at NuGet.PackageRepositoryExtensions.FindPackage(IPackageRepository repository, String packageId, SemanticVersion version, IPackageConstraintProvider constraintProvider, Boolean allowPrereleaseVersions, Boolean allowUnlisted)
   at NuGet.DataServicePackage.EnsurePackage(IPackageCacheRepository cacheRepository)
   at NuGet.DataServicePackage.get_FrameworkAssemblies()
   at NuGet.PackageExtensions.HasProjectContent(IPackage package)
   at NuGet.PackageWalker.GetPackageTarget(IPackage package)
   at NuGet.PackageWalker.GetPackageInfo(IPackage package)
   at NuGet.PackageWalker.Walk(IPackage package)
   at NuGet.InstallWalker.ResolveOperations(IPackage package)
   at NuGet.ServerExtensions.PackageMirrorer.Execute(IPackage package, IPackageOperationResolver resolver)
   at NuGet.ServerExtensions.PackageMirrorer.MirrorPackage(IPackage package, FrameworkName targetFramework, Boolean allowPrereleaseVersions, MirrorDependenciesMode mirrorDependenciesMode)
   at NuGet.ServerExtensions.PackageMirrorer.MirrorPackage(IPackage package, Boolean allowPrereleaseVersions, MirrorDependenciesMode mirrorDependenciesMode)
   at NuGet.ServerExtensions.PackageMirrorer.MirrorPackage(String packageId, SemanticVersion version, Boolean allowPrereleaseVersions, MirrorDependenciesMode mirrorDependenciesMode)
   at NuGet.ServerExtensions.MirrorCommand.ExecuteCommand()
   at NuGet.Commands.Command.Execute()
   at NuGet.Program.Main(String[] args)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Changes to nuget.config in directory of .sln should invalidate the cache" (#7237) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I suppose the correct repo for this issue would be https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Services.Platform, but it does not allow issues.

I changed the nuget.config (placed besides a solutions .sln-file) contents to update the location of a local repo. This config change apparently did not invalidate the cache, since i had to restart Visual Studio for packages to load from the correct source.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):
4.6.0

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):
15.8.1
OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:
Unknown if it worked at some point

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Use local repo, pull packages
2. change nuget.config file to point to different location
3. pull packages again
4. check output log - if it still points to the old repo path it's wrong

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Show source repository information for packages on nuget.org" (#30) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The spec to **Show source repository information for packages on nuget.org** , is ready for **review**:

|Spec wiki|Discussion issue|
|:----------|:------------------|
|[Show source repository information for packages on nuget.org](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Show-source-repository-information-for-packages-on-nuget.org) | https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4941 |

**Note**: This is a short term feature to just light up the repository information on nuget.org using the `<repository>`  metadata in the nuspec. We plan to revisit the detailed functionality, in future.
